result.execSummary:
The defendant Leo A. Esparza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Leo A. Esparza was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leo A. Esparza is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Leo A. Esparza was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Leo A. Esparza was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Leo A. Esparza was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Leo A. Esparza was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances.  May Not have contact with victim. DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

Count 5 - deft sentenced to 142 days KCJ.  Credit for 72 days KCJ.  Huber allowed.  Bond to be applied to the costs.  

Remaining counts - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 1yr - Ct 4, 3yrs - Ct 2, & 4yrs - Ct 3.  Probation sentences are concurrent to each other.  Probation commences today.  See conditions.  Bond to be applied towards financial obligations in these counts.  Balance of any costs due shall be paid during term of probation.  

DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

940.235(1) Strangulation & Suffocation, DV, Repeater - DISMISSED  /   940.30 False Imprisonment, DV, Repeater   /   940.45(1) Felony Intimidaton of Victim, DV, Repeater

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Same appearances as before.  Jurors convene @ 9:09am.  Preliminary instructions given to the jury.  Jury sworn.  Opening statement given by the State.  Defense reserves their opening statement.  Testimony commences.  State's witness - Allie B.  State's exhibits #1 thru #7 offered/received.  Court takes a recess to take another case.  Court reconvenes.  Testimony continues.  State's witness - Christopher T., & P.O. Sergio Martini.  State rests @ 11:32am.  Jurors released @ 11:33am; instructed to return @ 12:45pm.  Colliquey conducted with deft on the issue of whether he is going to take the stand.  Deft wishes to testify.  Parties instructed to return @ 12:45pm.  Court reconvenes @ 12:55pm.  Defense gives opening statement.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from deft.  Defense rests @ 1:30pm.  No rebuttal.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:45pm.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror - Christina M.  Jurors commence deliberations @ 2:54pm.  Verdict reached @ 4:19pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 4:25pm in the courtroom.  Deft found not guilty on count 1.  Deft found guilty on remaining counts.  Jury polled.  Jurors released @ 4:33pm.  State moves for judgment on the verdicts #2 thru #5; motion granted.  State moves for dismissal of count 1; motion granted.  Defense moves for judgment not withstanding the verdicts on counts 2 thru 5 - denied.  Deft admits to repeater.  Court inclined to revoke bond on counts 2 & 3; arguments heard.  Bond is revoked on counts 2 & 3; deft taken into custody.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 7/21/16 @ 10am.
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Parties ready to proceed with trial.  Voir dire commences @ 10am.  Jurors selected @ 10:54am.  Unselected jurors released @ 10:56am.  Preliminary instructions given to selected jurors.  Released for the day @ 11:10am; instructed to return @ 9am on 6/7/16.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  JS adj to 6/6/16 @ 9am due to another case going to trial.  NOTE - Atty Walker also has trial in Br 6 this day.
